creator: Bluemirrs 11
descriptionHtml:
With this app, you can quickly and easily store and retrieve information about your products: quantity, initial quantity, expiration date, purchase and opened dates, container (where the product is stored), price, and notes.

The main usage of this app is to manage expiration dates and quantity, but expiration date is optional, so you can use it also to track remaining quantity of products that do not expire.

If a product has an expiration date, you will be notified when that date is approaching (by default, you will receive three notifications for every expiring product, the exact timing of them depends on product's category, and is adjustable in the category edit page).

Products are grouped in categories. The app offer three built-in categories (food, pills and other), but you can add your own, and editing or deleting the existing ones.
Outside of categories, there is also a view that shows only expiring products, regardless of their category, and a view that shows all the stored products.
Products can also be viewed by their containers.

Details of products can be entered manually or by scanning their barcode . The first time you scan a new product, you will still need to enter its details manually. Starting from the next time, the app will remember the name of the product, the category, the quantity, the unit of measurement of the quantity and the expiration date entered for the last scan (even if it's likely that the latter will need to be updated manually).

In the product list, you can alternate between two views, the first one emphasizing expiration dates, the second the quantity. In the view that emphasizes quantity, you can decrease it without open the product detail page.

Products can be sorted by name, expiration and purchase date, and by quantity, in ascending or descending order.

You can export your data in a file and then import that file in the app later, so that when you change device you don't have to manually copying your data. You can also share the data file of this app with other apps, e.g. to send your product list with a messaging app to a friend or family member, or to another of your devices.

The app is free, displays no ads, and we don't sell your data to anyone.
descriptionShort: Store info about quantity and expiration dates of your products.

appDetails.recentChangesHtml:
• We have changed the way to perform actions on products in the main page.
Now, instead of long pressing an item to reveal options, just tap on it and a toolbar with some buttons will appear.
With these buttons you can:
• Duplicate a product;
• Edit a product;
• View the details of a product;
• Filter the list by product's category, container or name;
• Mark a product as opened;
• Delete a product.

• Improvements in app startup time.

With this app, you can quickly and easily store and retrieve information about your products: quantity, initial quantity, expiration date, purchase and opened dates, container (where the product is stored), price, and notes.

The main usage of this app is to manage expiration dates and quantity, but expiration date is optional, so you can use it also to track remaining quantity of products that do not expire.

If a product has an expiration date, you will be notified when that date is approaching (by default, you will receive three notifications for every expiring product, the exact timing of them depends on product's category, and is adjustable in the category edit page).

Products are grouped in categories. The app offer three built-in categories (food, pills and other), but you can add your own, and editing or deleting the existing ones.
Outside of categories, there is also a view that shows only expiring products, regardless of their category, and a view that shows all the stored products.
Products can also be viewed by their containers.

Details of products can be entered manually or by scanning their barcode . The first time you scan a new product, you will still need to enter its details manually. Starting from the next time, the app will remember the name of the product, the category, the quantity, the unit of measurement of the quantity and the expiration date entered for the last scan (even if it's likely that the latter will need to be updated manually).

In the product list, you can alternate between two views, the first one emphasizing expiration dates, the second the quantity. In the view that emphasizes quantity, you can decrease it without open the product detail page.

Products can be sorted by name, expiration and purchase date, and by quantity, in ascending or descending order.

You can export your data in a file and then import that file in the app later, so that when you change device you don't have to manually copying your data. You can also share the data file of this app with other apps, e.g. to send your product list with a messaging app to a friend or family member, or to another of your devices.

The app is free, displays no ads, and we don't sell your data to anyone.
descriptionShort: Store info about quantity and expiration dates of your products.

appDetails.recentChangesHtml:
• Dropbox integration: connect the app to your Dropbox account to be able to upload and download the data file of the app to / from Dropbox with a single tap.
• You can now delete all of your products or all of the data contained in the app.

title: Expiring Things

creator: Bluemirrs 11
descriptionHtml:
With this app, you can quickly and easily store and retrieve information about your products: quantity, initial quantity, expiration date, purchase and opened dates, container (where the product is stored), price, and notes.

The main usage of this app is to manage expiration dates and quantities, but expiration date is optional, so you can use it also to track location and remaining quantity of products that do not expire.

Functionalities:

• Add products with name, category, initial and remaining quantity, quantity unit, storage location, expiration date, purchase date, opened date, price and notes. Only name and category are mandatory fields, the other are optional.

• Add products choosing from a list of previously entered products.

• Add products by cloning an existing one.

• Add products by scanning their barcode. The first time you scan a new product, you will need to enter its details manually, because the app does not depend on external services to retrieve the product name. Starting from the next time, the app will remember the name of the product, the category, the quantity, the unit of measure of the quantity and the expiration date entered for the last scan.

• View products grouped by categories. Three default categories are provided at app start, but you can delete them and create your own.

• View products grouped by their storage location (called "containers" in the app).

• View products emphasizing their expiration date or their remaining quantity. In the view that emphasizes remaining quantity you can change it without opening the product details page.

• Sort products by name, expiration date, purchase date, opened date or remaining quantity.

• Search products by their name or part of it.

• Receive a notification when a product is about to expire. You receive three different notifications for each expiring product and you can change the timing on a per category basis. You can also choose to receive daily notifications for already expired products .You can set the time of the day at which notifications are fired. Please review your device's battery optimization settings if you don't receive notifications, or contact the developer for help.

• Export and import your data file for backup / restore purpose. You can also send the data file to yourself or other users via Gmail, WhatsApp or other application capable of sending files.

The app is free, displays no ads, and we don't sell your data.

• The app has now adapted to the authentication changes required by Dropbox
• Ability to sort products by last modified
• Ability to sort products by price
• Display of the total quantity of a product (including any other packages) in its detail page
• It is now possible to remove a product from the history of purchased products

title: Expiring Things

creator: Bluemirrs 11
descriptionHtml:
With this app, you can quickly and easily store and retrieve information about your products: quantity, initial quantity, expiration date, purchase and opened dates, container (where the product is stored), price, and notes.

The main usage of this app is to manage expiration dates and quantities, but expiration date is optional, so you can use it also to track location and remaining quantity of products that do not expire.

Functionalities:

• Add products with name, category, initial and remaining quantity, quantity unit, storage location, expiration date, purchase date, opened date, price and notes. Only name and category are mandatory fields, the other are optional.

• Add products choosing from a list of previously entered products.

• Add products by cloning an existing one.

• Add products by scanning their barcode. The first time you scan a new product, you will need to enter its details manually, because the app does not depend on external services to retrieve the product name. Starting from the next time, the app will remember the name of the product, the category, the quantity, the unit of measure of the quantity and the expiration date entered for the last scan.

• View products grouped by categories. Three default categories are provided at app start, but you can delete them and create your own.

• View products grouped by their storage location (called "containers" in the app).

• View products emphasizing their expiration date or their remaining quantity. In the view that emphasizes remaining quantity you can change it without opening the product details page.

• Sort products by name, expiration date, purchase date, opened date or remaining quantity.

• Search products by their name or part of it.

• Receive a notification when a product is about to expire. You receive three different notifications for each expiring product and you can change the timing on a per category basis. You can also choose to receive daily notifications for already expired products .You can set the time of the day at which notifications are fired. Please review your device's battery optimization settings if you don't receive notifications, or contact the developer for help.

• Upload and download your product list to / from Dropbox: in this way you can share the list of products between different devices and different users, provided they login into the same Dropbox account.

• Export and import your data file for backup / restore purpose. You can also send the data file to yourself or other users via Gmail, WhatsApp or other application capable of sending files.

The app is free, displays no ads, and we don't sell your data.

descriptionShort: Store info about quantity and expiration dates of your products.

appDetails.recentChangesHtml:
• Tags: you can now add arbitrary tags to your products. You can use tags for sub- or macro-categories, to memorize where the product was bought, for products' ingredients, for shopping list, and other!
• You can now adjust the font size of the text elements of the app.
• Better support for tablets: now, when there is enough horizontal space, the products are listed in two or more columns.

descriptionShort: Store info about quantity and expiration dates of your products.

appDetails.recentChangesHtml:
• Option to auto-upload to Dropbox while the app is open
• You can now hide consumed products from the main list
• You can now move a product to another container from the product context menu
• You can now navigate to a category's product list or a container's products list just by tapping the category's name or the container's name in the product listing in the main page
• You can now view the entire content of a note just by tapping the note icon in the main product list
